subject: Environmental Science

overview.description: Environmental science curriculum focusing on sustainable agriculture, ecosystem management, climate change, and environmental conservation in agricultural contexts

learning_objectives: Understand ecosystem interactions and environmental principles
Analyze environmental impacts of agricultural practices
Apply sustainable development concepts to agriculture
Evaluate climate change effects on agricultural systems
Develop environmental monitoring and conservation skills

units.title: Ecosystem Principles and Agricultural Interactions
learning_outcomes: Understand basic ecosystem structure and function
Analyze relationships between agriculture and natural ecosystems
Apply ecological principles to farming systems

lessons.title: Ecosystem Structure and Energy Flow
objectives: Identify components of agricultural ecosystems
Understand energy flow and nutrient cycling
Analyze food webs in agricultural environments

activities.description: Map ecosystem components in school agricultural area
Construct food webs and energy flow diagrams
Analyze nutrient cycling patterns in agricultural systems
Connect ecosystem principles to farming practices

lessons.title: Biodiversity in Agricultural Landscapes
objectives: Assess biodiversity levels in different agricultural systems
Understand the importance of genetic diversity in crops
Evaluate strategies for biodiversity conservation

activities.description: Conduct species diversity assessment in crop and natural areas
Compare biodiversity indices between different farming systems
Design biodiversity conservation strategies for farms
Present conservation recommendations

units.title: Environmental Pollution and Agricultural Impacts
learning_outcomes: Identify sources and types of environmental pollution
Analyze impacts of agricultural chemicals on ecosystems
Understand water quality and soil contamination issues
Develop pollution prevention and remediation strategies

lessons.title: Water Quality Monitoring and Agricultural Runoff
objectives: Test water quality parameters in agricultural areas
Understand nutrient pollution and eutrophication
Analyze the impact of pesticides on water systems

activities.description: Test pH, dissolved oxygen, nitrates, and phosphates in water samples
Trace pollution sources from farm to water bodies
Design strategies to reduce agricultural water pollution
Discuss findings and implications for sustainable farming

cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Water chemistry and analytical testing

lessons.title: Soil Contamination and Remediation
objectives: Identify soil contamination sources and indicators
Understand heavy metal pollution and pesticide residues
Apply bioremediation and phytoremediation techniques

activities.description: Collect and test soil samples for contamination indicators
Analyze soil health and contamination levels
Set up phytoremediation trials using hyperaccumulator plants
Develop long-term monitoring and remediation plan

cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Soil chemistry and remediation processes
Biology: Plant-soil interactions and plant physiology

units.title: Climate Change and Agricultural Adaptation
learning_outcomes: Understand climate change science and projections
Analyze impacts of climate change on agricultural systems
Develop climate adaptation strategies for farming
Evaluate carbon sequestration and mitigation options

lessons.title: Climate Change Impacts on Agriculture
objectives: Understand climate change drivers and projections
Analyze temperature and precipitation changes
Evaluate impacts on crop production and farming systems

activities.description: Analyze local climate data trends and projections
Assess climate impacts on specific crops and farming practices
Use crop models to predict yield changes under climate scenarios
Brainstorm adaptation strategies for local agriculture

cross_curricular_connections: Geography: Climate systems and weather patterns
Mathematics: Statistical analysis and trend interpretation

lessons.title: Carbon Sequestration and Agricultural Mitigation
objectives: Understand carbon cycling in agricultural systems
Evaluate soil carbon sequestration potential
Apply practices that reduce greenhouse gas emissions

activities.description: Measure soil organic carbon in different farming systems
Compare carbon storage between conventional and sustainable practices
Design farm-level climate mitigation strategies
Analyze economic benefits of carbon sequestration programs

cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Carbon chemistry and biogeochemical cycles
Economics: Environmental economics and carbon markets

units.title: Sustainable Agriculture and Environmental Management
learning_outcomes: Apply principles of sustainable agricultural development
Evaluate renewable energy applications in agriculture
Develop environmental monitoring and reporting protocols

lessons.title: Renewable Energy in Agricultural Systems
objectives: Understand renewable energy options for farms
Evaluate solar, wind, and biogas applications
Calculate energy efficiency and environmental benefits

activities.description: Conduct energy audit of farm operations and facilities
Design renewable energy systems for specific agricultural applications
Calculate energy production potential and environmental benefits
Analyze technical and economic feasibility

cross_curricular_connections: Physics: Energy conversion and electrical systems
Economics: Energy economics and investment analysis

lessons.title: Environmental Management Systems and Certification
objectives: Understand environmental management system principles
Apply ISO 14001 concepts to agricultural operations
Develop environmental monitoring protocols

activities.description: Assess current environmental management practices on farms
Develop environmental monitoring and reporting protocols
Prepare documentation for environmental certification
Plan continuous improvement strategies

cross_curricular_connections: Business Studies: Quality management and certification
Agriculture: Farm management and operational efficiency

field_studies: Water and soil quality monitoring programs

summative_assessments: Field study reports and data analysis (30%)

textbooks: Environmental Science for Agriculture - Malaysian Context

cross_curricular_integration.agriculture: Sustainable farming practices and ecosystem management
cross_curricular_integration.geography: Climate systems, hydrology, and spatial analysis
